definition[0]: to end a radio or television programme by saying goodbye
definition[1]: to write your final message at the end of an informal letter
example[0]: It’s getting late, so I’ll sign off now. Love, John.
definition[2]: if a doctor signs someone off, he or she gives them a note saying that they are ill and not able to work
example[1]: For the last month, she has been signed off sick from work.
definition[3]: to show that you approve of a plan or that something is finished by signing an official document
example[2]: Major repainting work now needs to be signed off by a qualified engineer.
